alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; South Laramie Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 31 at 9:16AM MST until February 01 at 2:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM MST WEDNESDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY HAS EXPIRED... * WHAT...Blowing and drifting snow. Localized ground blizzard conditions possible. Wind gusts up to 70 MPH. * WHERE...Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County including Bordeaux along Interstate 25 between Chugwater and Wheatland. * WHEN...Until 2 PM MST Wednesday. A lull in the strongest winds will occur this afternoon, with winds increasing again later this afternoon through Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Dangerous travel conditions due to significant blowing and drifting snow. Visibilities may be reduced to one quarter of a mile or less at times.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling, especially in open areas. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; South Laramie Range
